content: Middle East Technical University Northern Cyprus Campus (METU NCC) is the first overseas campus of a Turkish university. It was founded following an invitation by the governments of the Republic of Türkiye and the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus, with the foundation law adopted in 2003.
METU Northern Cyprus Campus is located in the Güzelyurt district of North Cyprus.
METU NCC offers 15 undergraduate and 5 graduate programs, providing the same academic quality and standards as the main campus in Ankara, Türkiye.
Food, beverages, and smoking are not allowed in the library. Users are responsible for their belongings, and the library is not responsible for theft or losses.
Users are required to switch off their mobile phones while inside the library.
Publications are protected with electronic security systems. No publications may be taken out of the library without permission, and legal measures will be taken against violations.
To borrow books from the library, users must present their current METU ID card at the circulation desk.
METU NCC undergraduate students may borrow up to 15 books for 15 days, while graduate students may borrow up to 20 books for 30 days.
METU NCC academic staff and PhD students may borrow up to 25 books for 30 days, while administrative staff may borrow up to 15 books for 30 days.
Academic and administrative staff may borrow up to 3 multimedia items for 3 days, while students may borrow up to 2 multimedia items for 3 days.
Members with overdue books cannot borrow new items until overdue materials are returned and fines are paid. Overdue books cannot be renewed.
Reference books and periodicals cannot be borrowed and must be used only inside the library.
Academic staff and research assistants may renew borrowed items up to three times, while students may renew items up to two times unless the item is requested by another user.
Academic staff, administrative staff, and students can borrow materials from the Reserve (Short Loan Section) for periods ranging from 2 hours to one week, depending on the source.
Students can borrow up to 3 books for 7 days at a time from the Easy Readings Collection.
The Library is open daily from 08:30 to 23:30.
Macro Market on campus sells basic food, cleaning, and consumer products and is managed by Macro Ltd. The contact telephone number is +90 392 661 1980-83.
The Kuzey Kıbrıs Turkcell (Çınar Telekom) office provides GSM services, photocopying, printing, and stationery items for the campus community. The contact telephone number is +90 392 661 1967.

The campus bookstore (Deniz Kırtasiye) sells textbooks recommended by academic units, stationery items, and provides photocopying and printing services. The contact telephone number is +90 392 661 2249.
The campus barber provides hair cutting services. The contact telephone number is +90 392 661 1963.
The campus hairdresser provides hair styling services. The contact telephone number is +90 392 661 1964.
The METU NCC branch of İşBank provides on-campus banking services on weekdays and has two ATM machines located in front of the bank. The contact telephone number is +90 392 661 1951-55.
The on-campus post office, a branch of the TRNC Post Office, provides all postal services to the campus community. The contact telephone number is +90 392 661 1977.
The à la carte and table d'hôte dining hall offers fixed-price menus including main and side dishes, soup, salad or yoghurt, and fruit or dessert.
The main cafeteria operated by Kırlangıç Catering offers fast food, grill selections, breakfast menus, cookies, cakes, and hot and cold beverages.
Canteens located in the School of Foreign Languages (SFL) and Dormitory I and II buildings serve fast food and hot and cold beverages.
Dormitory III canteen offers fast food, hot and cold beverages, and additional menu options.
MODA (Mutfacık), located in Dormitory I, offers ice cream, cookies, cakes, and hot and cold beverages.
TCHIBO (Southern Cafe) offers a variety of hot and cold drinks, desserts, and snacks and is located in the building with Atatürk's bust.
